title: Hybrid Acquisition of Temporal Scopes for RDF Data

author: Anisa Rula, University of Milano - Bicocca

segmentation: So today I'm going to present the working title hybrid acquisition of Temporal Scopes for RDF data.
This is a joint work from the University of Milano Bicocca and a CSW group so.
The outline of the Today talk will be as follows.
I will first introduce you, the problem and the motivation why why this problem is really relevant to link open data.

I will then show you the approach and go into details to all the elements of the approach and then I will also discuss about the experimental evaluation and then to conclude some summary of contributions and.

OK, so first of all we have a lot of data sets from different domains in the elody cloud and we have a lot of facts in those data set.
Some of these facts are considered to be always valid and some other facts are considered to be valid only for a certain time interval.
So these facts can change overtime and so this can be also named as volatile facts.

What is important here is that OK, we would like to represent volatile facts by RDF triples and at the same time we would like to represent their validity, which is defined by a time interval that we name as temporal scope.
